awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase II:  Adaptive Experiential Learning Platform to Close Learning Gaps in Secondary Algebra
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase II project seeks to close gaps in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) proficiency, improving participation and sustained achievement, particularly for historically underserved student populations. Learning science has validated that the mathematical sciences are processed experientially — through seeing, moving, doing, perceiving — but current educational solutions generally do not explore this learning modality.  This platform will utilize Immersive Virtual Reality (IVR) and advanced analytics to scale these best practice pedagogies for both students and teachers. The aim of this project is to actualize the vision of technology-assisted STEM learning and operationalize it across the US K-12 system to close long-standing barriers to access and proficiency at scale.  In the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic, this platform offers a way to rapidly close significant learning gaps students are facing.

This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase II project seeks to demonstrate how multimodal and game-driven learning in IVR can be used to enhance math proficiencies and the ability to transfer mathematical knowledge across contexts.  Such abilities have so far eluded incumbent learning technologies and interventions for math. In particular, this research may culminate in an experiential solution for students to learn Algebra efficiently, effectively, and purposefully. Immersed in relevant real-world contexts, students will use tactile 3D tools, movement, and a research-based pedagogical framework to build lasting fluency with math concepts while solving high impact problems. The platform will leverage the latest advances in data analysis to personalize learning experiences based on individual behaviors, skills and goals. This solution provides teachers with real-time data on student thinking so they can closely monitor, identify, and support priority students while providing timely feedback during critical cognitive moments.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
Since receiving our NSF SBIR award to design and develop an intelligent, immersive learning platform that increases proficiency on bottleneck topics in secondary STEM, Prisms has become the leading player on the cutting edge of next-gen computing technologies in secondary education. A randomized-controlled trial conducted across 22 teachers and 514 middle- and high-schoolers in Ohio yielded statistically significant results demonstrating an 11% improvement in student outcomes on standards-aligned assessments among those augmenting their learning with Prisms. The Prisms content library has expanded from a limited selection of Algebra I learning experiences to over 50 comprehensive, standards-aligned content modules spanning the entire 7th-through-11th grade math paradigm, High School Biology and High School Chemistry. Prisms is now serving more than 130,000 students in 200 school districts across 34 states.

 

There is enormous interest in and demand for adopting the fundamentally reimagined way of engaging students in practical, real-world problem solving that Prisms has become known for. To meet this surge in demand, over the next 12 months Prisms will continue to invest heavily in product improvements by building more content to reach a wider audience; expanding the use of intelligent agents to provide personalized just-in-time feedback to students at moments of productive struggle; and developing cross-platform instructional aids that ensure every student can derive enduring fluency from the Prisms learning experience.

 

Prisms will leverage the success of its early developmental era - made possible by the NSF SBIR award - to expand content offerings to span a fuller range of subjects in K-12; to foray into international markets; to design authoring tools that empower educators to create their own VR learning environments; and to explore a host of other strategies designed to position Prisms as the leading innovator in immersive learning. Prisms believes that a revolution is possible in how we teach and learn; that no student should be left to wonder at the relevance of the mathematical sciences; that with the right tools every student can become a subject matter expert; and that by leveraging the future of spatial computing, we can build a platform that breathes life, joy, and meaning into classrooms around the world.
